results.title: Bad boys of Hollywood
results.creator_credit: Scott Marvel, Matthew Hane and Amvest Video
results.brief_description: ‘Bad boys of Hollywood’ provides an irreverent look at the changing face of Hollywood and the men who contributed to the ‘bad boy’ image of Hollywood during the 20th Century. Errol Flynn is featured with behind the scenes stories of his drinking, philandering and devil may care mischief making. Sean Penn gives meaning to the phrase “Let’s party!” and Steve McQueen provides a bunch of Hollywood producers with his version of ‘piss-take’ humour. Presented are many stories about these bad but lovable rogues, men who symbolised a changing society and reached iconic status for their off-screen antics. Narrated by Jeff Lupetin this video also features: Ronald Reagan, Marlon Brando, Robert Mitchum, Jack Nicholson, James Dean and John Belushi. WARNING: POOR QUALITY SOUND LEVEL

results.title: BadJelly the witch
results.creator_credit: Anne Wood, Norma Farnes, Norma Farnes Management and Ragdoll Productions
results.brief_description: Spike Milligan narrates this animated story of two children in search of a lost cow and the adventures this leads them to. They come across interesting and friendly animals who indeed save them from the nasty witch, BadJelly, and her hungry, nasty friend. All ends up well for the children and their cow. Spike Milligan wrote the imaginative story as well as narrates.

results.title: Bad boy Bubby
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Domenico Procacci, Giorgio Draskovic, Bubby Pty Ltd (Adelaide) and Fandango
results.brief_description: Bubby (Nicholas Hope in a knockout performance) has spent the first thirty-five years of his life locked in a filthy room by a mother who systematically emotionally and sexually abuses him. His first encounter with his father ends in a violent confrontation which results in Bubby breaking through to the outside world. Alone and frightened, a child in an adult man’s body, he begins his first tentative steps into humanity. This strange, absorbing and distressing film is a stunning investigation into the alienation lacerating urban contemporary Australia. Watching the world through Bubby’s eyes challenges the viewer to re-examine our conventional ideas of what is “normal” and what is “strange”. Family, sexual politics, work, art, and adulthood are questioned by Bubby’s progress through the modern world. Winner of four AFI awards and the Grand Jury Special Prize at the Venice Film Festival.

results.title: Back alley blue
results.creator_credit: Bill Reid, Vladimir Valenta and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Stolen money, a love intrigue and police chase unite with the main theme which is a day in the life of an old woman who scratches out a living collecting used pop bottles and picking through back alleys. She is not too poor, however, to repay a kindness. The film ends on an unexpected note of humour. Stars Nan Steward, John Evans.

results.title: Babies Are People Too (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An anti-child abuse film for young mothers to give them a better understanding of how their infants develop during the first two years and how behaviour is an expression of their infant’s needs. The objective is to make better mothers, and hence, better adjusted babies.

results.title: Backs to the blast: an Australian nuclear story
results.brief_description: A history of the Uranium and nuclear industry in South Australia from 1910 to 1980, including archival footage and contemporary interviews with workers, scientists and politicians. Presents an analysis of the effects of uranium and its products and gives a detailed examination of Radium Hill, Port Pirie and Maralinga. Suitable for lower-mid Secondary students.

results.title: Babes in toyland
results.brief_description: Santa Claus’s incompetent assistants accidentally make some giant wooden soldiers, which come in useful when a villian tries to take over Toyland. A musical fantasy based on the Operetta by Victor Herbert and Glen McDonough with music adapted and conducted by George Bruns and choreography by Tom Mahoney. Stars Ray Bolger, Tommy Sands, Annette Funicello, Ed Wynn.

results.title: Babe: pig in the city
results.brief_description: The sequel to the 1995 surprise hit ‘Babe’ moves the action of the first film into the vast unknown of a sprawling metropolis. Along with the radical change comes a surprisingly dark undertone. What launches Babe’s adventure is an unfortunate well accident involving farmer Hoggett. Babe, along with Mrs Hoggett, must then head into the big city to drum up money and save the farm from bankruptcy. Once there the native duo are separated and Babe finds himself in a strange boarding house for animals. Although critics feared the film might have been too intense for kids, Miller’s film is full of compassion, pathos and unexpected poignanacy.

results.title: Babar: The City of Elephants
results.creator_credit: Raymond Jafelice, Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh and Patricia Loubert
results.brief_description: Babar Returns - Babar leaves the old lady and the city to return to the jungle so that he can bring the other elephants his newfound knowledge. But he finds that they resist trying any of his new ideas. “City of the Elephants” - As the elephants new king, Babar’s first decree is to build a city. However, he must contend with Lord Rataxes, who is also trying to build a city, as well as his own obsession to see his city completed on time. Rated: G

results.title: Babar. to Duet or Not to Duet; the Missing Crown Affair.
results.creator_credit: Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Laura Shepherd, Belvama-Ellipse, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Clifford Ross Co
results.brief_description: Two more animated versions of the Babar picture books. “To duet or not to duet”. The young Babar is scheduled to perform a duet with a great pianist at a concert, but he refuses to admit that the piece is too hard for him. “The missing crown affair” When Babar’s crown goes missing, Zephir decides to help solve the mystery. Could the stolen crown be the first step towards taking over Babar’s kingdom? Based on the picture books by Jean and Laurent de Brunhoff.
